qas.question: What is the name of Oklahoma Cities memorial?
What institute is located near the Oklahoma City National Memorial?

answers.text: Institute for the Prevention of Terrorism

context: <a0_0>The Oklahoma City National Memorial<a0_0/> in the northern part of Oklahoma City's downtown was created as the inscription on its eastern gate of the Memorial reads, "to honor the victims, survivors, rescuers, and all who were changed forever on April 19, 1995"; the memorial was built on the land formerly occupied by the Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building complex prior to its 1995 bombing. The outdoor Symbolic Memorial can be visited 24 hours a day for free, and the adjacent Memorial Museum, located in the former Journal Record building damaged by the bombing, can be entered for a small fee. The site is also home to the National Memorial <a1_0>Institute for the Prevention of Terrorism<a1_0/>, a non-partisan, nonprofit think tank devoted to the prevention of terrorism.
